com.phunware.alerts
Class PwAlertsIntentService

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.app.Service
              android.app.IntentService
                  com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService
                      com.phunware.alerts.PwAlertsIntentService
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
public abstract class PwAlertsIntentService
extends com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService

Phunware's Alerts Service uses Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) to deliver push notifications. Extend this class to receive alert responses from GCM. Make sure to name the class that is going to use PwAlertsIntentService as "GCMIntentService".

When an alert is received the data is then obtained and processed into a PwAlertExtras object. If there is an error retrieving or processing the data then onMessageAlertsError(Context, PwAlertExtras, Exception) is called. However if there are no issues then the alert data is passed to onMessageAlerts(Context, PwAlertExtras, JSONObject).

Method Detail

onMessageAlerts

public abstract void onMessageAlerts(android.content.Context context,
                                     PwAlertExtras extras,
                                     org.json.JSONObject data)
Gets called when an alert has been received. Callback provides Alert's payload.
Usage: Use this class to build your push notification.

Parameters:
context - Service context
extras - Addition information from alert service.
data - (Optional) This data is tied to the alert notification. This is a payload that is developer defined from the server.

onMessageAlertsError

public abstract void onMessageAlertsError(android.content.Context context,
                                          PwAlertExtras extras,
                                          java.lang.Exception error)
Gets called when an alert has been received, but fails to retrieve the alert's payload data.
Usage: Use this class to handle alert error. Error may be caused by no network. You may want to keep fails alert's extras and use it to reload the failed alert's data at a later time by call getAlertsData(pid).

Parameters:
context - Service context
extras - Addition information from alert service.
error - return exception error object.

onRegistered

public abstract void onRegistered(boolean isSuccessful,
                                  java.lang.String errMessage)
This is called when registration is successful or unsuccessful. The state is determined by the flag.

Parameters:
isSuccessful - true if device is registered, false if not.
errMessage - Null on success, if failure then a message is passed back.

onUnregistered

public abstract void onUnregistered(boolean isSuccessful,
                                    java.lang.String errMessage)
This is called when unregistration is successful or unsuccessful. The state is determined by the flag.

Parameters:
isSuccessful - true if device is unregistered, false if not.
errMessage - Null on success, if failure then a message is passed back.

getAlertsData

public org.json.JSONObject getAlertsData(android.content.Context context,
                                         java.lang.String pid)
                                  throws com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException
Get extra data associated with an Alert using it's associated PID. This only needs to be called if the PwAlertExtras are received in onMessageAlertsError(Context, PwAlertExtras, Exception).

Parameters:
context - a context to work with
pid - PID of the alert. This can be obtained with PwAlertExtras.getDataPID().
Returns:
If successful a JSON object is returned
Throws:
com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException - For a network error. Thrown if no data was found for the PID. Thrown if there is no internet connection.
